business.headline: US stock market crash: Why Sensex, Nifty aren't feeling the heatThe S&P BSE Sensex was down less than 170 points at around 11:35 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fluctuated between gains and losses. The 50-share index was down barely 20 points but showed no signs of panic. Broader market indices also stayed flat as volatility spiked.

Skipped filing ITR? You may get a tax notice very soonThe tax authorities use a risk management strategy (RMS) to flag high-risk non-filers, said the department.  This system looks at high-value transactions (property purchases, large bank deposits, etc.), income from salary, rent, mutual funds, and shares, etc.

IndusInd Bank share crash: Should you buy as stock falls 22% today?The decline in IndusInd Bank share price came after the bank, in an internal review of its derivative portfolio, found discrepancies that could reduce its net worth by an estimated 2.35%. This amounts to an impact of nearly Rs 1,577 crore.

US recession: Is it a possibility or just a Wall Street worry?The massive sell-off on Wall Street was triggered by Donald Trump's recent remark on the possibility of a US recession in 2025. But is a US recession actually looming?

IndusInd Bank shares crash 21% to hit 52-week low. Why is it falling today?IndusInd Bank stock price fall: IndusInd Bank's stock has lost nearly 50% in the past six months, with a 32% decline in the last four weeks alone. The stock fell nearly 4% to Rs 900.50 on the NSE in the previous session.

Sensex down nearly 400 points: Why is the stock market falling today? The Sensex fell nearly 400 points, while the Nifty dropped over 100 points as investors reacted to growing concerns about a possible recession in the US, along with a sharp fall in IT stocks.

Sensex, Nifty fall as US market crash rattles investors; IndusInd Bank down 10%The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 361.25 points to 73,753.92, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 113.65 points to 22,346.65 as of 9:16 AM.

Sensex, Nifty eye shaky opening as Wall Street crash spooks global marketsUS stock markets saw their biggest single-day fall since 2022 on Monday, March 10. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq crashed by up to 4%, while the Dow Jones dropped 2.08%.

IndusInd Bank shares in focus after Rs 1,577 crore networth hit riskThe stock fell nearly 4% to Rs 900.50 on the NSE in the previous session. IndusInd Bank's stock has lost more than 37% in the past six months, with a 16% decline in the last four weeks alone.

Tesla shares tumble almost 16% as US stock markets crashTesla shares plunged 15.4 per cent to USD 222.15 on Monday, their lowest since October, amid investor pessimism over slumping sales and Trump administration trade policy uncertainty. It was Tesla's steepest drop since September 2020.

Trump tariffs, recession fears slam US markets, wiping out $4 trillion in valueDonald Trump's tariffs have rattled investors, wiping out USD 4 trillion from the S&P 500 as trade uncertainty with Canada, Mexico, and China grows.

US stocks fall sharply as recession fears grow; Nasdaq down 4%US stocks fell sharply as concerns over tariffs and a potential government shutdown fuelled recession fears. The S&P 500 had its worst one-day drop since December, falling 2.7%, while the Nasdaq dropped 4%, confirming a correction.

entertainment.headline: American rock band Guns N' Roses to return to India after 12 years American rock band Guns N' Roses will return to India after 12 years. They will perform in Mumbai on May 17.

Kim Soo-hyun denies 'baseless' relationship claims with late actor Kim Sae-ronActor Kim Soo-hyun and his agency Gold Medalist have rejected allegations made by the YouTube channel Garosero Research Institute. The accusations suggest a past relationship with the late Kim Sae-ron and blame the agency for her financial woes.

KKK 14's Aditi Sharma heads for divorce, husband alleges infidelity in 4 monthsTV actor Aditi Sharma's marital bliss was short-lived as her husband Abhineet Kaushik accused her of cheating. This comes just four months after their secret wedding on November 12, 2024.

Mallika Sherawat in talks for Khatron Ke Khiladi 15: ReportMallika Sherawat is reportedly in talks for Khatron Ke Khiladi 15. While her participation isn't confirmed, she recently returned to Bollywood and is now looking for her next big project.

Singer Isabel LaRosa on performing at Lolla India: The experience was surrealIsabel LaRosa, known for hits like Favourite and I'm Yours, recently performed at Lollapalooza India. She discussed her music-making process and experience with India Today Digital.

Dhanashree Verma restores photos with Yuzvendra Chahal amid rumours of divorceDhanashree Verma restored Instagram photos with Yuzvendra Chahal amid divorce rumours. While her lawyer confirmed court proceedings, her family denied claims of a Rs 60 crore alimony demand.

Udit Narayan mocks the kiss row at 'Pintu Ki Pappi' eventVeteran playback singer Udit Narayan opened up about the viral kiss incident a month after backlash. He discussed the timeline of the video where he is seen kissing his female fans.

Ashish Chanchlani makes public appearance after India's Got Latent row. WatchContent creator Ashish Chanchlani made a rare public appearance in Mumbai amid controversy surrounding Ranveer Allahbadia's comment on India's Got Latent.

Watch: Hip Hop India 2 trailer promises to raise intensity, higher the stakesHip Hop India, the country's hip-hop dance reality show, is set to return for its second season on Amazon MX Player, promising even more thrilling performances and intense dance battles.

You 5 trailer: Penn Badgeley's Joe Goldberg returns for a killer finaleThe trailer for You Season 5 is out, showcasing the last chapter of Joe Goldberg's saga. Streaming starts April 24 on Netflix, with Joe facing past demons.
South Korean singer Wheesung found dead at 43Popular South Korean soloist Wheesung was found dead at his home on Monday. The authorities are still investigating the matter.

Meghan Markle's father criticises her show, mocks her for putting flowers on food Meghan Markle's estranged father, Thomas Markle, talked about her Netflix show, 'With Love, Meghan', in an interview. He called her 'fake', and mentioned that she should have had a more relatable show for women who are not privileged like her.

general news.headline: Karnataka orders probe into Ranya Rao's cop father over protocol breachGold smuggling case: Karnataka orders probe into role of Ranya Rao's IPS father in protocol breach at airport

Stalin's anti-Hindi stand gets troll treatment with 'Yappa Yappa Stalin Appa'Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin is facing an unusual wave of trolling over his stand against the "Hindi imposition". The BJP seized the moment to highlight what they call DMK's hypocrisy on the three-language policy.

Pakistani envoy denied entry, deported from US in rare incident: ReportPakistan's ambassador to Turkmenistan, KK Ahsan Wagan, was deported from Los Angeles despite holding a valid visa and all legal travel documents.

The 50-share index was down barely 20 points but showed no signs of panic. Broader market indices also stayed flat as volatility spiked.
India has democracy, not democratic valuesMost parties in India are family-run circuses and the one that isn't has different family values, not strictly democratic values, to guide it.

Hotelier's grandson arrested in gold smuggling case, was friends with Ranya RaoThe DRI has arrested Tarun Raju, grandson of Atria Hotel's owner, in Bengaluru for his alleged role in the gold smuggling case linked to actor Ranya Rao, sources said. His arrest follows Rao's recent detention with gold worth Rs 12.56 crore.

Fingers of Dalit student on his way to exam chopped, family says caste violenceA Class 11 student from Scheduled Caste community was attacked and his fingers were chopped off by a gang of three men in Tirunelveli, Tamil Nadu. His family claimed it was caste-related violence because the student defeated caste Hindus in a Kabaddi match.

PM's déjà vu moment? When Modi visited 'Mini India' Mauritius 27 years agoPM Modi in Mauritius: Known as 'mini India' due to its large Indian-origin population, Mauritius holds a special place in PM Modi's heart. The connection dates back 27 years, when Modi first went to Mauritius to address the Ramayana Conference.

SRK's comforting words to nervous Shaitaan actor at IIFA 2025 win the InternetShaitaan actor Janki Bodiwala won her first IIFA award, presented by Shah Rukh Khan. Overwhelmed, she called it a "dream come true." SRK comforted her on stage, winning fans over with his humility.

Buying a Tesla tomorrow: Trump backs Elon Musk amid boycott, plunging sharesDonald Trump has pledged to buy a Tesla, calling it a stand against an "illegal boycott" of Elon Musk. His announcement follows nationwide protests targeting Tesla over Musk's role in the Trump administration.

Man kills 'unfaithful' girlfriend, calls her friend: She was proud of her beautyA man killed his 17-year-old girlfriend by slitting her throat in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur, claiming she was unfaithful. Then, he called the victim's friend and confessed to the crime, saying "she was very proud of her beauty".

Rohit, Kohli show there is more than one way to answer retirement callsVirat Kohli and Rohit Sharma answered their critics in fine fashion and guided India to their third Champions Trophy title on Sunday, March 9. With no retirement on the horizon for both men, is the famous Ro-Ko aiming for a World Cup 2027 bow?

ED summons Bhupesh Baghel's son day after raids in Chhattisgarh liquor 'scam'The Enforcement Directorate has summoned former Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel's son Chaitanya Baghel on March 15, a day after raids in connection with an alleged money laundering in a liquor scam.

Chandigarh crash: 1 killed, scooter split in two after being dragged by PorscheA speeding Porsche allegedly hit two scooters in Chandigarh's Sector 4, killing one man and injuring two women. The impact of the collision was such that the scooter rider's body was cut into two peices.

IndusInd Bank shares crash 21% to hit 52-week low. Why is it falling today?IndusInd Bank stock price fall: IndusInd Bank's stock has lost nearly 50% in the past six months, with a 32% decline in the last four weeks alone. The stock fell nearly 4% to Rs 900.50 on the NSE in the previous session.

US influencer gets romantic note from pilot, apologises after video goes viralA US-based influencer apologised after a video of her claiming that she received a romantic note from an unknown pilot went viral on social media.

Why Yogi Adityanath backs Sambhal cop in Holi-Friday namaz rowThe Uttar Pradesh CM, speaking at the India Today Conclave 2025, underlined the segregated Holi-Friday prayers plan for the district. On DSP Anuj Kumar Chaudhary, he said…

Kerala girl dies after water fasting: What extreme weight-loss diets do to the bodyAn 18-year-old girl from Kerala tragically died from anorexia after following extreme water fasting inspired by online portals. Experts warn against crash diets and prolonged fasting, citing severe health risks.

Chandrayaan missions reveal hidden wonders of the cold lunar worldThese new discoveries could serve as a vital resource for future lunar missions, potentially aiding in the establishment of sustainable habitats on the Moon.
Can drinkable sunscreen replace your regular one?Drinkable sunscreen is an oral supplement designed to provide internal sun protection by helping the body combat UV damage from within.

Why are US and Ukraine holding talks on ending war with Russia in Saudi Arabia?After a tense Trump-Zelenskyy clash in February, the US and Ukraine will hold talks in Saudi Arabia to discuss ending the war with Russia. What makes Jeddah the chosen venue?

Who checks your CBSE board exam papers? Here's what you need to know CBSE makes different staff appointments, such as paper setters, moderators, secrecy officers, head examiners, and examiners, to administer the examination process.

This city's air is the most polluted in India. It's not DelhiThirteen of the world's top 20 most polluted cities are in India, with Byrnihat in Assam topping the list. Delhi, however, remains the most polluted capital city globally.

Bhumi Pednekar goes back to school at Harvard Kennedy, calls it 'fun'Bhumi Pednekar visited Harvard Kennedy School for a leadership program. She called it an 'amazing' experience and shared glimpses from her time there, including learning sessions and a pizza break.

Harry Potter's Jessie Cave to post 'sensual hair videos' on OnlyFans to clear debtHarry Potter actor Jessie Cave announced that she is joining the OnlyFans social media platform to share 'sensual' and 'fetish' content which is not explicitly sensual. She said she would be making good-quality hair videos for the followers.

Russo Brothers confirm next trip to India: We're coming to Mumbai for AvengersRusso Brothers, Joseph and Anthony, expressed their desire to visit India again in an exclusive conversation with India Today. He also spoke about visiting Mumbai for Avengers promotions.

Sara Ali Khan gives shout-out to brother Ibrahim amid Nadaaniyaan backlashSara Ali Khan has stepped up to support her brother Ibrahim Ali Khan amid the backlash surrounding his latest release Nadaaniyan. The film is currently streaming on Netflix.

sports.headline: RCB can play party-spoilers for Mumbai Indians. Here's howWPL 2025: The match between Mumbai Indians (MI) and Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) on Tuesday at the Brabourne Stadium would decide the finalist for the ongoing edition.

Why Indian team won't have felicitation ceremony after Champions Trophy winThe Indian team won't have a felicitation ceremony after their Champions Trophy win on Sunday, March 9 against New Zealand. The players are slowly returning home after their title win with IPL 2025 season set to start.

All England Open Badminton Championships: When and where to watch Double Olympic medallist PV Sindhu, Lakshya Sen are amongst the Indian stars to take part in the All England Open Badminton Championships 2025 to be staged from March 11 to 16 in Birmingham.

No Shakib, Mahmudullah opts out as BCB reveal 2025 central contract listShakib Al Hasan was overlooked as Mahmudullah decided to opt out of the Bangladesh Cricket Board's central contract list for 2025. Taskin Ahmed was the only player to be given the Grade A+ contract.

Some Manchester United players not 'good enough', some 'overpaid': Jim RatcliffeManchester United co-owner Jim Ratcliffe has delivered a damning verdict on the current squad, saying some of the players are not 'good enough'. Ratcliffe also gave his backing to current manager Ruben Amorim.

Watch: After Champions Trophy win, Ravindra Jadeja joins CSK in 'Pushpa' styleAfter helping India win the Champions Trophy, Ravindra Jadeja arrived at the Chennai Super Kings team base with some 'Pushpa' swag on Monday, March 10. Jadeja will be a key player for Chennai this season.

Sports Ministry revokes suspension of Wrestling Federation of India The Sports Ministry has revoked the suspension of the Wrestling Federation of India (WFI). Back in December 2023, the Ministry had suspended the WFI over taking hasty decision and showing disregard for the existing rules and regulations.

Rohit, Kohli show there is more than one way to answer retirement callsVirat Kohli and Rohit Sharma answered their critics in fine fashion and guided India to their third Champions Trophy title on Sunday, March 9. With no retirement on the horizon for both men, is the famous Ro-Ko aiming for a World Cup 2027 bow?

Haris Rauf blessed with baby boy before New Zealand T20IsPakistan speedster Haris Rauf became a father with wife Muzna Masood Malik. Rauf's teammates Shadab Khan and Shaheen Shah Afridi took to social media to congratulate the pacer.

Another injury blow to Mayank Yadav, pacer to miss 1st half of IPL: Report IPL 2025: LSG fast bowler Mayank Yadav is racing against time to recover from the back injury he sustained last year. The speedster could only play four games last year due to a side strain.

Transitioning New Zealand deserve to be put on a high pedestal   Champions Trophy 2025: Despite not having Matt Henry, their premier fast bowler and the leading wicket-taker of the tournament, New Zealand, with their limited resources, made India work hard in the final on Sunday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
